definitions.definition: A large quantity or number; a great deal.
examples: win the whole lot (of money); i.e. jackpot

definitions.definition: A separate, appropriated portion; a quantized, subdivided set consisting a whole.
examples: The Lord divided the land to the tribes, each according to his lot .

definitions.definition: One or more items auctioned or sold as a unit, separate from other items.
A number of people taken collectively.
A distinct portion or plot of land, usually smaller than a field.
examples: a building lot in a city

definitions.definition: That which happens without human design or forethought.
Anything (as a die, pebble, ball, or slip of paper) used in determining a question by chance, or without human choice or will.
The part, or fate, that falls to one, as it were, by chance, or without one's planning.
All members of a set; everything .
examples: The table was loaded with food, but by evening there was nothing but crumbs; we had eaten the lot .
If I were in charge, I'd fire the lot of them.

definitions.definition: An old unit of weight used in many European countries from the Middle Ages , often defined as 1/30 or 1/32 of a (local) pound .

main_definition: A large quantity or number; a great deal.
secondary_definitions: A separate, appropriated portion; a quantized, subdivided set consisting a whole.
One or more items auctioned or sold as a unit, separate from other items.
( informal ) A number of people taken collectively.
A distinct portion or plot of land, usually smaller than a field.
That which happens without human design or forethought.
Anything (as a die, pebble, ball, or slip of paper) used in determining a question by chance, or without human choice or will.
The part, or fate, that falls to one, as it were, by chance, or without one's planning.
( definite , the lot ) All members of a set; everything .
( historical ) An old unit of weight used in many European countries from the Middle Ages , often defined as 1/30 or 1/32 of a (local) pound .
